attributes.action: Give key workers coming off maternity furlough or PAID extended maternity leave.
attributes.additional_details: As a key worker during the pandemic if I go back to work I’m unable to get any childcare, I can’t send my baby to family because of the risk. Im currently stuck in a situation where I don’t have a choice, if I don’t go back we won’t have money to live on, if I do my baby doesn’t have any childcare. This leaves people with only one option and that’s to take unpaid maternity or leave to take care of the child. If you aren’t in a public funded company you get furloughed for childcare, I’d like to see the same for public funded company’s.
attributes.background: Keyworkers on maternity leave have been overlooked, currently if you are due to come back to a public funded workplace after the paid 9 months you have to either take unpaid leave to take care of your baby or use holidays. I’d like to see maternity leave and pay extended or furloughed.

rejection.details:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/306691

Because of the above petition, the Petitions Committee conducted an inquiry into the impact of Covid-19 on maternity leave, including the specific circumstances for those who work for the public sector. It has published a report and made recommendations to the Government. You can find out more here: https://www.parliament.uk/business/committees/committees-a-z/commons-select/petitions-committee/news-parliament-2017/parental-leave-report/
